column4: every time i try using apt to install or remove a package [either at the command line or via synaptic], i get an error that a colon must follow a field name.  full error at http://tons.pastebin.com/d70fa1dd1
use apt-get clean.  Don't manually delete system files.
then how do I correct this error?  http://tons.pastebin.com/d70fa1dd1
any attempted package install or removal, via apt or synaptic
you can safely delete it, and do a "sudo apt-get update"
in generel, don't touch/remove system files like that, but this is an exception
dpkg: failed to open package info file `/var/lib/dpkg/available' for reading: No such file or directory
that's from a "sudo apt-get update" after deleting it?
no, that's from an install after update
after an apt-get update, is the file recreated?
and are you using any unoffocial repositories?
